list_definition.definition: to reduce to a lower level, especially of importance

list_ex_of_english: With this as a basis, we will then turn to downgrading.
Crucially, when a rating agency downgrades a security to speculative grade, the agency has effectively commanded certain regulated investors to sell.
The police believe that to define that offence specifically could be too prescriptive and could lead to other equivalent offences being downgraded.
There is no question of our downgrading the effort; we want to upgrade the effort.
The vast majority of those downgraded will be working normally, albeit with their deployability limited by their medical condition.
The learners used a variety of syntactic downgrading with more accuracy than lexical downgrading.
Is it true that his position is downgraded?
Moral virtue would be downgraded because it would no longer be required for heaven.
